alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Clay; Owsley; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:17PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Owsley, northern Perry and southwestern Breathitt Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 116 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lucky Fork, or 9 miles southeast of Booneville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Morris Fork around 120 PM EDT. Buckhorn, Dalesburg, Crockettsville, Talbert, Sebastian`s Branch, Buckhorn Lake S.P., Houston and Turkey around 125 PM EDT. Bush Branch, Altro, Beech, Wolf Coal, Gays Creek and Canoe around 130 PM EDT. Barwick, Whick, Lamont, Chavies, Little, Copland, Saldee, Howard Creek, Krypton and Haddix around 135 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Ned, Watts, Hardshell, Clayhole, Flintville, Lost Creek, Rowdy, Noble, Dice and Ary. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway near mile marker 59. Kentucky Highway 80 in Perry County between mile markers 9 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
